sentences.en: Drunk on his own chivalry, Ashurst went on murmuring.
sentences.cn: 艾舍斯特沉醉于自己的骑士精神, 继续嘟囔着.

sentences.en: Far from undermining this chivalry of age , the Chinese people have reinforced it.
sentences.cn: 对于老年人应受尊敬这一问题, 中国人远非贬损它,而是强调它.

sentences.en: He admires the chivalry of knights in Middle Ages.
sentences.cn: 他很佩服中世纪武士的侠义精神。

sentences.en: He had a sort of instinctive chivalry in him.
sentences.cn: 在他身上有一种天生的骑士风度.

sentences.en: He looked up at them with great chivalry.
sentences.cn: 他非常有礼貌地抬头瞧她们.

sentences.en: He was admired for his chivalry.
sentences.cn: 他因他的骑士风度而受到景仰.

sentences.en: He was ever the soul of the chivalry.
sentences.cn: 他历来就是骑士中的精华.

sentences.en: It troubled him, arousing vague feelings of attraction and chivalry.
sentences.cn: 这使他很不好受, 心里隐隐引起一阵倾慕和骑士的热肠.

sentences.en: Marie seemed to revel in his old-fashioned chivalry.
sentences.cn: 玛丽好像陶醉在他那旧式的骑士风度里。

sentences.en: The Apple Tree; dual personality; pity; chivalry; romantic; bourgeois.
sentences.cn: 《苹果树》; 两面性; 怜悯; 骑士精神; 浪漫化; 资产阶级.

sentences.en: The Order of the Garter is an ancient order of chivalry.
sentences.cn: 嘉德勋位是古老的骑士勋位.

sentences.en: Those are the flowers of Spanish chivalry.
sentences.cn: 那些人是西班牙骑士精神的精华.

sentences.en: Who said that the age of chivalry was dead?
sentences.cn: 谁说骑士风尚的时代已一去不复返了?

sentences.en: Would it not be common chivalry to make her independent, if she wished?
sentences.cn: 只要她愿意,使她能独立 、 自主,这岂不是普通的侠义精神 吗 ?

sentences.en: Yes, and when it runs up against chivalry?
sentences.cn: 对, 可是违反了骑士精神的时候 呢 ?

words.tran_cn: 骑士精神（复数chivalries）；骑士制度

trans.tran_cn: （中世纪的）骑士制度，骑士气概，骑士品质
trans.tran_en: behaviour that is honourable, kind, generous, and brave, especially men’s behaviour towards women
